data.title: Movies This Week: Tashkent Files, Marudhar Express, Albert Pinto Ko Gussa Kyun Aata Hai and PM Narendra Modi
meta_keywords: Albert Pinto Ko Gussa Kyun Aata Hai?
data.meta_description: Movies This Week: Tashkent Files, Marudhar Express, Albert Pinto Ko Gussa Kyun Aata Hai and PM Narendra Modi - The Tashkent Files, Marudhar Express and Albert Pinto Ko Gussa Kyun Aata Hai, which movie will you watch?
data.text:
Seen all the latest releases running in theatres? Waiting for a new listing? Well, here we are with the names of the movies which you will be able to enjoy this week. We have no biggies this time but some really intriguing stories up for release. You can enjoy four very different films - a thriller, a comedy-drama, a remake of the 1980s and a biopic. We know movies are a big part of your plans and so without further ado, let's get going...

The Tashkent Files

Cast: Naseeruddin Shah, Mithun Chakraborty, Mandira Bedi, Pankaj Tripathi, Shweta Basu Prasad, Ankur Rathee, Anchit Kaur, Vinay Pathak, Pallavi Joshi

Director: Vivek Agnihotri

Synopsis: The Tashkent Files is a Bollywood thriller about the death of Indian prime minister Lal Bahadur Shastri. Commenting on the story of the film the director Vivek said that it is going to be the country’s first crowd-sourced thriller. He further stated that the film will be made after doing research work on Shastriji as it will be an apolitical film about a political leader.

Here's the gripping trailer of the film...

Marudhar Express

Cast: Tara-Alisha Berry, Rajesh Sharma, Kunaal Roy Kapur

Director: Vishal Mishra

Synopsis: Marudhar (Kunaal Roy Kapur) is the son of a cruel father, Ashok Pandey (Rajesh Sharma). He is noble from his childhood days due to his strict father and thus is an introvert person. He doesn’t have any experience of dealing with women and trudges along in his life. His father plans an arranged marriage for him and he can't have no for an answer. Marudhar marries a sweet and pretty girl from Lucknow named Chitra. But the twist comes when they are under the pressure of bearing a child right after their marriage. Marudhar sets on an emotional and equally entertaining journey as he tries to find his feet in the middle of love life, and family.

In case you missed it, here's the trailer of the film...

Albert Pinto Ko Gussa Kyun Aata Hai

Cast: Manav Kaul, Nandita Das, Saurabh Shukla, Kishore Kadam, Atul Kale

Director: Soumitra Ranade

Synopsis: The film is a remake of 1980's classic of the same name. The film follows Albert who disappears one morning. His girlfriend Stella files a complaint with the police and when he doesn't return after days, she begins to fear. What she doesn't know is that Albert is traversing a road journey from Mumbai to Goa. Nayar who drives the vehicle accompanies him on his mission. Punctuating their cynical, witty and devastating conversations, we see Albert's flashbacks of a world where he and Stella try and weave a life together. Albert's anger stems from experiences that life has presented to him. It is this anger that is taking him on a journey to settle scores and enable him to lead a life of dignity and hope.

PM Narendra Modi:

Cast: Vivek Anand Oberoi, Barkha Bisht, Boman Irani, Zarina Wahab, Prashant Narayanan, Manoj Joshi

Director: Omung Kumar

Synopsis: The film is a biopic on current Prime Minister of India, Shri Narendra Damodardas Modi.

During the casting process, Paresh Rawal was selected to play Narendra Modi but later he dropped out of the project. The makers then selected Vivek Oberoi to play the role. The film was supposed to release on 12 April originaly but the makers pushed up by a week that is 5th April. According to recent reports the film will finally release on 11th April 2019.

In case you haven't seen the trailer yet, watch it here...

Three different yet interesting stories, which one will you watch first? Let us know by tweeting to us @bollywood_life...

Stay tuned to BollywoodLife for the latest scoops and updates from Bollywood, Hollywood, South, TV and Web-Series.
